page.title: 04Life in the Country,Ashey
page.content: Mr and Mrs J Rayment live in a small lane near Gatehouse Farm. Since the war, not much has changed.There are only 3 extra bungalows, and the railway has closed.The{old station at the bottom of the lane has been converted into a smart house.It is very peaceful to live there. As it's out in the country,there are not any shops. Mrs Rayment goes to Tesco for her shopping. Some mornings, she gets pheasants, woodpeckers and mallard ducks in the garden. Mrs Rayment has a dog, a cat, a budgie, a tortoise and 15 goldfish. She is also looking after her daughter's pet chinchilla.
